intro: Bernardia hirsutissima var. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy bernardia, is a species native to South America, particularly Brazil. It is a shrub characterized by its dense, hairy foliage and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, typical of the Malvaceae family. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in ecological and horticultural contexts.
